title: Domain 3.6: Given a scenario, deploy and configure multifunction devices/printers and settings.
content:
📦 Properly Unboxing a Device – Setup Location

  • Use flat, stable surface with ventilation and access
  • Near power/network/user areas
  • Keep packaging until full functionality confirmed
  • Use ESD precautions if needed

🧠 Tip: Printer in a bad spot? Look for airflow or access issues.

🧩 Use Appropriate Drivers for the OS

  • Use correct version for the OS (e.g., Win 11 64-bit)
  • Best source: Manufacturer website
  • Other: Windows Update (limited), CD (outdated)

PCL vs PostScript

  • PCL: Fast, standard for Windows
  • PostScript: Precision for Mac or graphic design

🧠 Tip: PostScript = better for images. PCL = better for text.

🌐 Device Connectivity

  • USB: Direct to PC
  • Ethernet: Wired, shared access
  • Wireless: Requires Wi-Fi config

🧠 Tip: Choose based on network layout and user location.

👥 Public/Shared Devices

  • Printer Sharing: Enabled via OS or print server
  • Print Server: Centralizes and manages jobs/permissions/logs

🧠 Tip: Reduces end-user PC load, adds print control.

⚙️ Configuration Settings

  • Duplex: Double-sided printing
  • Orientation: Portrait vs Landscape
  • Tray Selection: Paper type and size
  • Quality: DPI vs speed

🧠 Tip: Wrong double-sided output? Check duplex settings.

🔒 Security Features

  • User Authentication: Login before printing
  • Badging: ID-based access/release
  • Audit Logs: Tracks activity for security/billing
  • Secured Prints: Requires PIN or badge for release

🧠 Tip: Useful for confidential print environments.

🌐 Network Scan Services

  • Email: Requires SMTP config
  • SMB: Sends to shared folders with permissions
  • Cloud: Google Drive, Dropbox, etc. via login

🧠 Tip: Managed through the printer’s web interface.

📑 Scanning Hardware

  • ADF: Feeds multiple pages, good for forms/contracts
  • Flatbed: Manual scanning, best for IDs/books

🧠 Tip: Duplex ADF = scans both sides automatically.
